name: RetrieveCustomEventDefinitions
description:
Retrieve existing custom event definitions from Hubspot.

Use this tool to obtain the current list of custom event definitions stored in Hubspot. It helps in understanding or displaying existing events configured within your system.

parameters.name: event_name_search_string
parameters.description: String of characters to search for in event names. This is a simple 'contains' search without fuzzy matching.

value_schema.description: Characters in the event name that the user is searching for. This search is a naive “contains” search, no fuzzy matching is done.

parameters.name: paging_cursor_token
parameters.description: The token indicating the position after the last successfully read resource for continued paged results.

value_schema.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: results_per_page_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of event definitions to retrieve per page.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the order to sort results. Use 'ASC' for ascending or 'DESC' for descending.

parameters.name: include_event_properties
parameters.description: Include event properties in the response. Set to true to include all properties.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Hubspot Events API

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: Characters in the event name that the user is searching for. This search is a naive “contains” search, no fuzzy matching is done.

value_schema.description: Characters in the event name that the user is searching for. This search is a naive “contains” search, no fuzzy matching is done.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

value_schema.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
